Column Comment.0: STANDARD METHOD SET IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a set or group ofstandard methods. Often, these would identify a method, consisting of severaldifferent steps, that are included in a typical analysis.
Column Comment.1: STANDARD METHOD SET IDENTIFIER: A unique identifier for a set or group ofstandard methods. Often, these would identify a method, consisting of severaldifferent steps, that are included in a typical analysis.
Column Comment.2: EQUIPMENT OBSERVATION NUMBER: A unique number which allows for multipleobservations by a piece of equipment during sample analysis.
Column Comment.3: TOLERANCE OBSERVATION NUMBER: A unique observation number for thetolerance in the analysis.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y or N flag indicating whether this row of data is currentlyeither active/valid (Y) or inactive/invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: EFFECTIVE DATE: The date that the data in this row first came into effect.
Column Comment.6: EXPIRY DATE: The date that the data in this row was no longer active or in effect.
Column Comment.7: MAXIMUM TOLERANCE: The maximum tolerance for the value capable while stillkeeping the analysis valid.
Column Comment.9: MAXIMUM TOLERANCE REPRESENTATION: The string or characters that areused to indicate that a measure exceeds the capability of this equipment to measure.
Column Comment.11: MINIMUM TOLERANCE: The minimum tolerance for the value capable while stillkeeping the analysis valid.
Column Comment.13: MINIMUM TOLERANCE REPRESENTATION: The string or characters that are usedto indicate that a measure is too small for the equipment to measure
Column Comment.15: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.16: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.17: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.18: SUBSTANCE IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for a substance that can be describedeither chemically or in terms of composition. Elements, ions, isotopes, isomers,minerals, chemicals, solvents, production substances, hydrocarbons etc are all listed.Be advised that many applications and agencies may use the same term, but thedefinition and composition details may not be the same. Use the SUBSTANCE XREFtable to capture relationships between substances, such as similar substances.
Column Comment.19: TOLERANCE DESCRIPTION: A narrative description of the tolerance for thismeasurement.
Column Comment.20: ANALYSIS TOLERANCE TYPE: A list of the types of tolerances for validmeasurements in an analysis. Tolerances may be related to instrument (equipment)limitations or scientific limits.
Column Comment.21: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.22: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.23: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.24: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.25: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.26: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.27: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
